member.name: F:jQueryApi.SelectMenuOptions.NativeMenu
F:jQueryApi.SelectMenuOptions.HidePlaceholderMenuItems
member.summary:
Placeholder options
It's common for developers to include a "null" option in their select element to force a user to choose an option. If a placeholder option is present in your markup, jQuery Mobile will hide them in the overlay menu, showing only valid choices to the user, and display the placeholder text inside the menu as a header. A placeholder option is added when the framework finds:
-An option with no value attribute (or an empty value attribute) -An option with no text node -An option with a data-placeholder="true" attribute. (This allows you to use an option that has a value and a textnode as a placeholder option).
You can disable this feature through the selectmenu plugin's hidePlaceholderMenuItems option, like this: $.mobile.selectmenu.prototype.options.hidePlaceholderMenuItems = false;

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.hash
member.summary: The fragment component of the URL, including the leading '#' character.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.host
member.summary: The host and port number of the URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.hostname
member.summary: The name of the host within the URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.href
member.summary: The original URL that was parsed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.pathname
member.summary: The path of the file or directory referenced by the URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.port
member.summary: The port specified within the URL. Most URLs rely on the default port for the protocol used, so this may be an empty string most of the time.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.protocol
member.summary: The protocol for the URL including the trailing ':' character.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.search
member.summary: The query component of the URL including the leading '?' character. But it also contains additional properties that provide access to additional components as well as some common forms of the URL developers access:

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.authority
member.summary: The username, password, and host components of the URL

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.directory
member.summary: The directory component of the pathname, minus any filename.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.domain
member.summary: The protocol and authority components of the URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.filename
member.summary: The filename within the pathname component, minus the directory.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.hrefNoHash
member.summary: The original URL minus the fragment (hash) components.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.hrefNoSearch
member.summary: The original URL minus the query (search) and fragment (hash) components.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.password
member.summary: The password contained within the authority component.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.UrlObject.username
member.summary: The username contained within the authority component.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.allowSamePageTransition
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) By default, changePage() ignores requests to change to the current active page. Setting this option to true, allows the request to execute. Developers should note that some of the page transitions assume that the fromPage and toPage of a changePage request are different, so they may not animate as expected. Developers are responsible for either providing a proper transition, or turning it off for this specific case.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.changeHash
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) Decides if the hash in the location bar should be updated.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.data
member.summary: (object or string, default: undefined) The data to send with an Ajax page request. - Used only when the 'to' argument of changePage() is a URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.dataUrl
member.summary: (string, default: undefined) The URL to use when updating the browser location upon changePage completion. If not specified, the value of the data-url attribute of the page element is used.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.pageContainer
member.summary: (jQuery collection, default: $.mobile.pageContainer) Specifies the element that should contain the page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.reloadPage
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Forces a reload of a page, even if it is already in the DOM of the page container. - Used only when the 'to' argument of changePage() is a URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.reverse
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Decides what direction the transition will run when showing the page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.role
member.summary: (string, default: undefined) The data-role value to be used when displaying the page. By default this is undefined which means rely on the value of the @data-role attribute defined on the element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.showLoadMsg
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) Decides whether or not to show the loading message when loading external pages.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.transition
member.summary: (string, default: $.mobile.defaultPageTransition) The transition to use when showing the page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions.type
member.summary: (string, default: "get") Specifies the method ("get" or "post") to use when making a page request. - Used only when the 'to' argument of changePage() is a URL.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.AnimationComplete
member.summary: jQuery Mobile exposes the animationComplete plugin, which you can utilize after adding or removing a class that applies a CSS transition. It can be used with page transition events. jQueryMobile

member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageLoadFailed
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageBeforeChange
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageChange
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageChangeFailed
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageBeforeShow
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageBeforeHide
member.summary: jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageShow
member.summary: Triggered on the "toPage" after the transition animation has completed. Callbacks for this event will receive a data object as their 2nd arg. param prevPage (object): A jQuery collection object that contains the page DOM element that we just transitioned away from. Note that this collection is empty when the first page is transitioned in during application startup. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageHide
member.summary: Triggered on the "fromPage" after the transition animation has completed. Callbacks for this event will receive a data object as their 2nd arg. jQueryMobile param: nextPage (object) A jQuery collection object that contains the page DOM element that we just transitioned to.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageBeforeCreate
member.summary: Triggered on the page being initialized, before most plugin auto-initialization occurs. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageCreate
F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageInit
F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.PageRemove
member.summary: By default, the framework removes any non active dynamically loaded external pages from the DOM as soon as the user navigates away to a different page. The pageremove event is dispatched just before the framework attempts to remove the page from the DOM. Event callbacks can call preventDefault on the event object to prevent the page from being removed. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.UpdateLayout
member.summary: This event is triggered by components within the framework that dynamically show/hide content, and is meant as a generic mechanism to notify other components that they may need to update their size or position. Within the framework, this event is fired on the component element whose content was shown/hidden, and bubbles all the way up to the document element. $( '#foo' ).hide().trigger( 'updatelayout' ); jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.Tap
member.summary: Triggers after a quick, complete touch event. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.Taphold
member.summary: Triggers after a held complete touch event. $.event.special.tap.tapholdThreshold (default: 750ms) – This value dictates how long the user must hold their tap before the taphold event is fired on the target element. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.Swipe
member.summary: Triggers when a horizontal drag of 30px or more (and less than 75px vertically) occurs within 1 second duration but these can be configured: $.event.special.swipe.scrollSupressionThreshold (default: 10px) – More than this horizontal displacement, and we will suppress scrolling. $.event.special.swipe.durationThreshold (default: 1000ms) – More time than this, and it isn't a swipe. $.event.special.swipe.horizontalDistanceThreshold (default: 30px) – Swipe horizontal displacement must be more than this. $.event.special.swipe.verticalDistanceThreshold (default: 75px) – Swipe vertical displacement must be less than this. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.SwipeLeft
member.summary: Triggers when a swipe event occurred moving in the left direction. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.SwipeRight
member.summary: Triggers when a swipe event occurred moving in the right direction. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.OrientationChange
member.summary: Triggers when a device orientation changes (by turning it vertically or horizontally). When bound to this event, the callback function has one argument, the event object. The event object contains an orientation property equal to either "portrait" or "landscape". Note that we currently bind to the resize event when orientationchange is not natively supported, or when $.mobile.orientationChangeEnabled is set to false. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.ScrollStart
member.summary: Triggers when a scroll begins. Note that iOS devices freeze DOM manipulation during scroll, queuing them to apply when the scroll finishes. We're currently investigating ways to allow DOM manipulations to apply before a scroll starts. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.ScrollStop
member.summary: Triggers when a scroll finishes. jQueryMobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VClick
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touchend or mouse click events. On touch devices, this event is dispatched *AFTER* vmouseup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMouseCancel
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touch or mouse mousecancel events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMouseDown
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touchstart or mousedown events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMuseMove
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touchmove or mousemove events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMouseOut
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touch or mouseout events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMouseOver
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touch or mouseover events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryEvents.VMouseUp
member.summary: Normalized event for handling touchend or mouseup events

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryPageBeforeLoadEvent.Url
member.summary: The absolute or relative URL that was passed into $.mobile.loadPage() by the caller.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryPageBeforeLoadEvent.AbsoluteUrl
member.summary: The absolute version of the url. If url was relative, it is resolved against the url used to load the current active page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryPageBeforeLoadEvent.DataUrl
member.summary: The filtered version of absUrl to be used when identifying the page and updating the browser location when the page is made active.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryPageBeforeLoadEvent.Deferred
member.summary: Callbacks that call preventDefault() on the event, *MUST* call resolve() or reject() on this object so that changePage() requests resume processing.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.jQueryPageBeforeLoadEvent.Options
member.summary: This object contains the options that were passed into $.mobile.loadPage().

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.data
member.summary: (object or string, default: undefined) The data to send with an Ajax page request.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.loadMsgDelay
member.summary: (number (in ms), default: 50) Forced delay before the loading message is shown. This is meant to allow time for a page that has already been visited to be fetched from cache without a loading message.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.pageContainer
member.summary: (jQuery collection, default: $.mobile.pageContainer) Specifies the element that should contain the page after it is loaded.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.reloadPage
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Forces a reload of a page, even if it is already in the DOM of the page container.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.role
member.summary: (string, default: undefined) The data-role value to be used when displaying the page. By default this is undefined which means rely on the value of the @data-role attribute defined on the element.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.showLoadMsg
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Decides whether or not to show the loading message when loading external pages.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions.type
member.summary: (string, default: "get") Specifies the method ("get" or "post") to use when making a page request.

member.name: T:jQueryApi.Mobile
member.summary: jQueryMobile $.mobile

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.activeBtnClass
member.summary: (string, default: "ui-btn-active") The CSS class used for "active" button state.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.activePage
member.summary: Reference to the page currently in view.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.activePageClass
member.summary: (string, default: "ui-page-active") The CSS class used for the page currently in view or in a transition.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.AjaxEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) jQuery Mobile will automatically handle link clicks and form submissions through Ajax, when possible. If false, URL hash listening will be disabled as well, and URLs will load as ordinary HTTP requests.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.allowCrossDomainPages
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) When jQuery Mobile attempts to load an external page, the request runs through $.mobile.loadPage(). This will only allow cross-domain requests if $.mobile.allowCrossDomainPages is set to true. Because the jQuery Mobile framework tracks what page is being viewed within the browser's location hash, it is possible for a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack to occur if the XSS code in question can manipulate the hash and set it to a cross-domain URL of its choice. This is the main reason that the default setting for $.mobile.allowCrossDomainPages is set to false. In PhoneGap apps that must "phone home" by loading assets off a remote server, both the $.support.cors AND $.mobile.allowCrossDomainPages must be set to true.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.autoInitializePage
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) When the DOM is ready, the framework should automatically call $.mobile.initializePage. If false, the page will not initialize and will be visually hidden until $.mobile.initializePage is manually called.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.HoverDelay
member.summary: (integer, default: 200) Set the delay for touch devices to add the hover and down classes on touch interactions for buttons throughout the framework. Reducing the delay here results in a more responsive feeling ui, but will often result in the downstate being applied during page scrolling.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.DefaultDialogTransition
member.summary: (string, default: 'pop') Set the default transition for dialog changes that use Ajax. Set to 'none' for no transitions.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.DefaultPageTransition
member.summary: (string, default: 'fade') Set the default transition for page changes that use Ajax. Note: default changed from 'slide' to 'fade' in 1.1. Set to 'none' for no transitions.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.getMaxScrollForTransition
member.summary: (integer, default: 3) Set a scroll position breakpoint for transitions. If the scroll position is greater than the window height multiplied by the value that has been set, transition "none" will be used.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.gradeA
member.summary: Function that returns a boolean, default: a function returning the value of $.support.mediaquery Any support conditions that must be met in order to proceed.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.HashListeningEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) jQuery Mobile will automatically listen and handle changes to the location.hash. Disabling this will prevent jQuery Mobile from handling hash changes, which allows you to handle them yourself or use simple deep-links within a document that scroll to a particular id.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.ignoreContentEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Warning: Setting this property to true will cause performance degradation on enhancement. Once set, all automatic enhancements made by the framework to each enhanceable element of the user's markup will first check for a data-enhance=false parent node. If one is found the markup will be ignored. This setting and the accompanying data attribute provide a mechanism through which users can prevent enhancement over large sections of markup.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.LinkBindingEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) jQuery Mobile will automatically bind the clicks on anchor tags in your document. Setting this option to false will prevent all anchor click handling including the addition of active button state and alternate link bluring. This should only be used when attempting to delegate the click management to another library or custom code (such as Backbone.js, in order to use the router exclusively to handle all hashchange events. The jQuery Mobile $.mobile.changePage() method could be used to programatically change the page)

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.LoaderOptions
member.summary: Loader prototype options ($.mobile.loader.prototype.options)

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.maxTransitionWidth
member.summary: (integer, boolean, default: false) Set a max width for transitions. The option accepts any number representing a pixel width and its default value false. If a number value is set, transition "none" will be used if the window is wider than the specified value.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.minScrollBack
member.summary: (integer, default: 250) Minimum scroll distance that will be remembered when returning to a page.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.ns
member.summary: (string, default: "") The namespace used in data attributes (e.g., data-role). Can be set to any string, including a blank string which is the default. When using, it's clearest if you include a trailing dash, such as "mynamespace-" which maps to data-mynamespace-foo="...". If you use data- namespacing, you will need to update/override one selector in the theme CSS. The following data selectors should incorporate the namespace you're using: .ui-mobile [data-mynamespace-role=page], .ui-mobile [data-mynamespace-role=dialog], .ui-page { ...

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.path
member.summary: Url utilities.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.pageLoadErrorMessage
member.summary: (string, default: "Error Loading Page") Set the text that appears when a page fails to load through Ajax.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.pageLoadErrorMessageTheme
member.summary: (string, default: "e") Set the theme that the error message box uses.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.phonegapNavigationEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) Replace calls to window.history.back with PhoneGap's navigation helper where it is available. This addresses navigation issues on page refresh in Android PhoneGap applications using jQuery Mobile.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.PushStateEnabled
member.summary: (boolean, default: true) Enhancement to use history.replaceState in supported browsers, to convert the hash-based Ajax URL into the full document path. Note that we recommend disabling this feature if Ajax is disabled or if external links are used extensively.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.subPageUrlKey
member.summary: (string, default: "ui-page") The url parameter used for referencing widget-generated sub-pages (such as those generated by nested listviews). Translates to example.html&ui-page=subpageIdentifier. The hash segment before &ui-page= is used by the framework for making an Ajax request to the URL where the sub-page exists.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.Mobile.transitionFallbacks
member.summary: ([transition] string, default: "fade") Set the fallback transition for browsers that don't support 3D transforms for a specific transition type.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.ChangePage(System.Object)
member.summary: Programmatically change from one page to another. This method is used internally for the page loading and transitioning that occurs as a result of clicking a link or submitting a form, when those features are enabled.
member.param: (string or object, required) String: Absolute or relative URL. ("about/us.html") Object: jQuery collection object. ($("#about"))

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.ChangePage(System.Object,jQueryApi.ChangePageOptions)
member.summary: Programmatically change from one page to another. This method is used internally for the page loading and transitioning that occurs as a result of clicking a link or submitting a form, when those features are enabled.
member.param: (string or object, required) String: Absolute or relative URL. ("about/us.html") Object: jQuery collection object. ($("#about"))

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.Loading(System.String)
member.summary: Show or hide the page loading message, which is configurable via $.mobile.loader prototype options as described in the widget docs or can be controlled via a params object.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.Loading(System.String,jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions)
member.summary: Show or hide the page loading message, which is configurable via $.mobile.loader prototype options as described in the widget docs or can be controlled via a params object.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.LoadPage(System.String)
member.summary: Load an external page, enhance its content, and insert it into the DOM. This method is called internally by the changePage() function when its first argument is a URL. This function does not affect the current active page so it can be used to load pages in the background. The function returns a deferred promise object that gets resolved after the page has been enhanced and inserted into the document.
member.param: (string or object, required) A relative or absolute URL.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.LoadPage(System.String,jQueryApi.LoadPageOptions)
member.summary: Load an external page, enhance its content, and insert it into the DOM. This method is called internally by the changePage() function when its first argument is a URL. This function does not affect the current active page so it can be used to load pages in the background. The function returns a deferred promise object that gets resolved after the page has been enhanced and inserted into the document.
member.param: (string or object, required) A relative or absolute URL.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.Mobile.SilentScroll(System.Int32)
member.summary: Scroll to a particular Y position without triggering scroll event listeners.
member.param: (number, defaults to 0). Pass any number to scroll to that Y location.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions.theme
member.summary: (string, default: "a") The theme swatch for the message.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions.text
member.summary: (string, default: "loading") The text of the message.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions.textonly
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) If true, the "spinner" image will be hidden when the message is shown.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions.textVisible
member.summary: (boolean, default: false) If true, the text value will be used under the spinner.

member.name: F:jQueryApi.MobileLoaderOptions.html
member.summary: (string, default: "") If this is set to a non empty string value, it will be used to replace the entirety of the loader's inner html.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method for determining the directory portion of an URL. If the URL has no trailing slash, the last component of the URL is considered to be a file.
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.
member.returns: This function returns the directory portion of a given URL.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.IsAbsoluteUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method for determining if a URL is absolute.
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.
member.returns: This function returns a boolean true if the URL is absolute, false if not.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.IsRelativeUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method for determining if a URL is a relative variant.
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.
member.returns: This function returns a boolean true if the URL is relative, false if it is absolute.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.IsSameDomain(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Utility method for comparing the domain of 2 URLs.
member.param: (string, required) An absolute URL to resolve against.
member.returns: This function returns a boolean true if the domains match, false if they don't.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.MakePathAbsolute(System.String)
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.MakeUrlAbsolute(System.String)
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.

member.name: M:jQueryApi.MobilePath.ParseUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method for parsing a URL and its relative variants into an object that makes accessing the components of the URL easy. When parsing relative variants, the resulting object will contain empty string values for missing components (like protocol, host, etc). Also, when parsing URLs that have no authority, such as tel: urls, the pathname property of the object will contain the data after the protocol/scheme colon.
member.param: (string, required) A relative or absolute URL.
member.returns: This function returns an object that contains the various components of the URL as strings. The properties on the object mimic the browser's location object.
